File 2

Load packages and reread files using the prebuilt load files function


```{r, load software packages}
rm(list = ls())

#we first establish the location of the working directory where we keep everything, depending on whether it exists (i.e. which computer we are using)
#check C drive
#take the working directory otherwise, which should work every time
if(!exists("location_of_main_folder")){
  location_of_main_folder <- getwd()
}

#paste the name of our functions folder into the path name
location_of_functions_folder <-
  paste0(location_of_main_folder, "/ar_functions_folder/")

#load the function that loads all the libraries and sources
source(paste0(location_of_functions_folder, "load_ar_libraries_and_sources_function.R"))

#paste together the location of the data files - we don't load in the first file, but we need this location for the end
location_of_data_files <-
  paste0(location_of_main_folder, "/ar_data_files_to_load/")

#run the function, pointing it towards the functions folder
load_ar_libraries_and_sources_function(
  location_of_functions_folder=location_of_functions_folder,
  location_of_data_files=location_of_data_files
)

#we load the ar_participants just to compare dates of visits
load_ar_files_function(previous_file_name = "file_1",
  parent_directory = location_of_data_files,
  list_of_data_frames_to_load=list("ar_participants"))
```

1 mole of NaCl has 58.45g of NaCl in it. 1mmol of NaCl therefore has 0.05845g of NaCl

```{r, combine all different types of converted salt into one column}
#we want to know the total grams of salt people have

#we have to wait in some cases until we have an interpolated weight, and thus we will also need a column as to whether this is absolute or per_kg. 

#we want one column for salt dose, and one column for if it is absolute or per_kg

#we start with those that have the absolute dose

ar_participants$converted_salt_mass <-
  ar_participants$total_daily_salt_entered_absolute_g

print("Check: this should be zero")

sum(!is.na(ar_participants$converted_salt_mass)) -
  sum(!is.na(ar_participants$total_daily_salt_entered_absolute_g))

#if we have that, then we know it is absolute

ar_participants$converted_salt_per_kg_or_absolute <-
  ifelse(!is.na(ar_participants$converted_salt_mass),
         "absolute",
         NA)
  
#if we don't have a salt weight, then look at the total_daily_salt_substance_mmol

#start off by taking the substance whether it is absolute or per_kg
ar_participants$converted_salt_per_kg_or_absolute <-
  ifelse(is.na(ar_participants$converted_salt_per_kg_or_absolute),
         ar_participants$total_daily_salt_substance_per_kg_or_absolute,
         ar_participants$converted_salt_per_kg_or_absolute) 

#then we need to convert the amount of mmol by 0.05845 to get to grams of salt
ar_participants$converted_salt_mass <-
  ifelse(is.na(ar_participants$converted_salt_mass),
         ar_participants$total_daily_salt_substance_mmol * 0.05845,
         ar_participants$converted_salt_mass) 

print("Check: this should be zero")

sum(!is.na(ar_participants$converted_salt_mass)) -
  sum(!is.na(ar_participants$total_daily_salt_entered_absolute_g)) -
  sum(!is.na(ar_participants$total_daily_salt_substance_mmol))

a <- ar_participants[,c(
  "Salt.replacement.note...Current.Medication",
  "converted_salt_mass",
  "total_daily_salt_entered_absolute_g",
  "total_daily_salt_substance_mmol",
  "total_daily_salt_traditional_fluid_volume",
  "salt_note_conversion_error")]
```


```{r, combine all different types of converted salt into one column}
#if we don't have salt in mmol, then look at total_daily_salt_traditional_fluid. first we take whether it is per_kg or absolute from _per_kg_or_absolute

ar_participants$converted_salt_per_kg_or_absolute <-
  ifelse(is.na(ar_participants$converted_salt_per_kg_or_absolute),
         ar_participants$total_daily_salt_traditional_fluid_per_kg_or_absolute,
         ar_participants$converted_salt_per_kg_or_absolute) 

#to then calculate the amount of salt in the fluid, we use the percentage and the volume
#to do that we use the equation percentage_strength/100 * volume in mls = grams of salt
#because:

#1kg of alst in 1 litre of 100% sodium chloride
#1 g of salt in 1ml of 100% sodium chloride 
#0.1 g of salt in 1ml of 10% sodium chloride
#0.3g of salt in 1ml of 30% sodium chloride
#3g of salt in 10ml of 30% sodium chloride

ar_participants$converted_salt_mass <-
  ifelse(is.na(ar_participants$converted_salt_mass),
         ar_participants$total_daily_salt_traditional_fluid_volume * 
           ar_participants$total_daily_salt_traditional_fluid_percentage/100 ,
         ar_participants$converted_salt_mass) 

print("Check: this should be zero")
sum(!is.na(ar_participants$converted_salt_mass)) -
  sum(!is.na(ar_participants$total_daily_salt_entered_absolute_g)) -
  sum(!is.na(ar_participants$total_daily_salt_substance_mmol)) -
  sum(!is.na(ar_participants$total_daily_salt_traditional_fluid_volume))

ar_participants$alert <-
  ifelse(!is.na(ar_participants$total_daily_salt_entered_absolute_g) &
           !is.na(ar_participants$total_daily_salt_substance_mmol) |
           !is.na(ar_participants$total_daily_salt_entered_absolute_g) &
           !is.na(ar_participants$total_daily_salt_traditional_fluid_volume) |
           !is.na(ar_participants$total_daily_salt_traditional_fluid_volume) &
           !is.na(ar_participants$total_daily_salt_substance_mmol) ,
         1,
         0)

freq(ar_participants$alert )
```


```{r, combine all different types of converted salt into one column}

  ar_participants$Age.at.first.presentation...CAH.First.Presentation == "1 - 3 months" | 
  ar_participants$Age.at.first.presentation...CAH.First.Presentation == "1" | 
  ar_participants$Age.at.first.presentation...CAH.First.Presentation == "< 1 month" |
    is.na(ar_participants$Age.at.first.presentation...CAH.First.Presentation), 0, 1)

ar_participants$age_at_first_known_over_3_months <- ifelse(
    is.na(ar_participants$Age.at.first.presentation...CAH.First.Presentation), NA, 
    ar_participants$age_at_first_known_over_3_months)
```

```{r, convert manually_corrected_dob to posix}
#we now create our manually corrected date of birth column with posixct from the CORRECTED date of birth column having incorporated centre information
ar_participants$manually_corrected_dob <-
  as.POSIXct(ar_participants$manually_corrected_dob, format="%d/%m/%Y")

ar_participants$id_visit_date <- 
  paste(ar_participants$id , ar_participants$visit_date, sep="_")

nrow(ar_participants)

```

```{r, total number of visits and calculating duplicated visits, and filtering out duplicated visits}
print("total number of visits bearing in mind some are duplicated with the same id_visit_date")
nrow(ar_participants)
number_before_filtered <- nrow(ar_participants)

ar_participants_filtered <- 
  ar_participants %>% 
  group_by(id_visit_date) %>% 
  slice_max(id, with_ties = F)

print("total number of visits with no id_visit_date duplications")
nrow(ar_participants_filtered)

ar_participants_filtered_id_visit_date_frequencies <-
  as.data.frame(freq(ar_participants_filtered$id_visit_date))

ar_participants <- ar_participants_filtered

print("Number of duplicated rows removed:")

number_before_filtered - nrow(ar_participants_filtered)
```

we want to know whether the patient has ever taken fludrocortisone:

```{r, create ever_taken_fludro to tell us whether ever taken fludrocortisone }
#first get a code for if fludro is classified as yes at any visit
ar_participants$ever_taken_fludro <- 
  ifelse(ar_participants$Fludrocortisone...Current.Medication=="Yes", 
         1, 
         0)

#correct NAs as assuming No
ar_participants$ever_taken_fludro <- 
  ifelse(is.na(ar_participants$ever_taken_fludro), 
         0, 
         ar_participants$ever_taken_fludro)

#slice the ever_taken_fludro so if it is 1 then the id gets given 1, otherwise it will be zero
ever_taken_fludro_frame <- 
  ar_participants %>% 
  group_by(id) %>% 
  slice_max(ever_taken_fludro, 
            n=1, 
            with_ties=F)

#get rid of the column that was defined by each individual visit
ar_participants$ever_taken_fludro <- NULL

#give each visit the column again by joining to the id
ever_fludro_to_join <- 
  ever_taken_fludro_frame[,c("id",
                     "ever_taken_fludro")]

#join it in 
ar_participants_with_ever_taken_fludro <- 
  dplyr::left_join(ar_participants, 
                   ever_fludro_to_join, 
                   by="id")

print("these two numbers should be the same:")

print("this number needs to be zero:")

nrow(ar_participants) - nrow(ar_participants_with_ever_taken_fludro)

ar_participants <-
  ar_participants_with_ever_taken_fludro
```

```{r, pull out day month and year in order to code spurious_original_dob_code and spurious_manually_corrected_dob_code}
#Note the original date of birth and the manually corrected date of birth are now in slightly different formats so need addressing with slightly different code to pull out day, month and year separately

ar_participants$text_manually_corrected_dob <-
  as.character(ar_participants$manually_corrected_dob)

ar_participants$text_original_dob <-
  as.character(ar_participants$Date.of.birth...Birth)

ar_participants$day_of_birth <- 
  as.numeric(gsub(pattern="[0-9][0-9][0-9][0-9]\\-[0-9][0-9]\\-", 
                  replacement="", 
                  x=ar_participants$text_manually_corrected_dob))

ar_participants$day_of_birth_original <- 
  as.numeric(gsub(pattern="\\/.*", 
                  replacement="", 
                  x=ar_participants$text_original_dob))

#first we remove year to get the month. Using as.numeric removes any preceding zeros
ar_participants$month_of_birth <- 
  sub(pattern="[0-9][0-9][0-9][0-9]\\-", 
      replacement="", 
      x=ar_participants$text_manually_corrected_dob)

#first we remove year to get the month. Using as.numeric removes any preceding zeros
ar_participants$month_of_birth_original <- 
  sub(pattern="\\/[0-9][0-9][0-9][0-9]", 
      replacement="", 
      x=ar_participants$text_original_dob)

#then from that, we remove the days
ar_participants$month_of_birth <- 
  as.numeric(sub(pattern="\\-[0-9][0-9]", 
      replacement="", 
      x=ar_participants$month_of_birth))

#then from that, we remove the days
ar_participants$month_of_birth_original <- 
  as.numeric(sub(pattern="[0-9][0-9]\\/", 
      replacement="", 
      x=ar_participants$month_of_birth_original))

#for year we remove month and days
ar_participants$year_of_birth <- 
  as.numeric(gsub(pattern="\\-[0-9][0-9]", 
                  replacement="", 
                  x=ar_participants$text_manually_corrected_dob))

#for year we remove month and days
ar_participants$year_of_birth_original <- 
  as.numeric(gsub(pattern=".*\\/", 
                  replacement="", 
                  x=ar_participants$text_original_dob))

separating_date_of_birth_check_frame <- 
  ar_participants[,c(
    "id",
    "text_manually_corrected_dob",
    "text_original_dob",
    "manually_corrected_dob",
    "Date.of.birth...Birth",
    "day_of_birth",
    "day_of_birth_original",
    "month_of_birth",
    "month_of_birth_original",
    "year_of_birth",
    "year_of_birth_original")]

print("review the separating_date_of_birth_check_frame to check that separating the dates has worked okay - the code would need tweaking if dates are recorded in a different format than expected")
```

```{r, code date of birth as spurious with spurious_original_dob_code}
ar_participants$spurious_original_dob_code <- 
  as.integer(ifelse(ar_participants$day_of_birth_original==1 & 
                    ar_participants$month_of_birth_original==1, 
                   1, 
                   0))

ar_participants$spurious_manually_corrected_dob_code <- 
  as.integer(ifelse(ar_participants$day_of_birth==1 & 
                    ar_participants$month_of_birth==1, 
                   1, 
                   0))

print("original percentage with a spurious date of birth:")
round(
  subset(
    rownames_to_column(
      as.data.frame(
        freq(
          ar_participants$spurious_original_dob_code)
        )), rowname==1)$`% Valid`, digits=1)

print("percentage with a spurious date of birth, even after corrections that occur in file 1:")
round(
  subset(
    rownames_to_column(
      as.data.frame(
        freq(
          ar_participants$spurious_manually_corrected_dob_code)
        )), rowname==1)$`% Valid`, digits=1)

```
